body:
What is your goal?

  • Click to website
  • Mobile app install

Website

If your goal is to drive clicks back to your website or conversions within your website, our goal is to put your ads where they will be seen on both desktops and mobile devices.

Ad Image

Your image file must meet the following specification to be accepted:

File format: JPEG, GIF (static), or PNG

File size: 1MB maximum

Image dimensions: 600x315

20% Text Limit: Facebook notes that images with minimal text are more engaging. Limit any text to 20% of the image surface. Want to double check? Inspect your image with Facebook's Grid Tool.
Ad Text

Once your image is accepted, you'll submit the text portions of your ad:

Text (required): 90 characters, including spaces.

  • This is the main message that you want to share with your visitors.
  • Your goal is to give your visitors a compelling reason to act.

Title (required): 25 characters, including spaces.

  • This is the headline that appears below your ad image.
  • Your goal is to grab your visitors’ attention in one line.

Link Description (optional): 200 characters, including spaces.

  • This is the text that appears below your headline.
  • Use this field to provide any additional information you want to share. A description of what your business does, for example.

*Destination URL: Website or landing page URL
Ad Placement

Facebook has four placement types:

1. Desktop News Feed
2. Mobile News Feed
3. Facebook Right-Hand Column (RHC)
4. Facebook Audience Network (FAN)

*Destination URL vs Display URL

Destination URL is the address that the user is redirected to when the ad is clicked on. This is the URL that you provide while creating your ad. Display URL is the URL that is shown within the ad.

Destination URLs are usually long and end up cluttering your creative. The Display URL gives you the opportunity to set a short, sweet, and compelling URL within the creative to help improve customer engagement.

This Display URL is automatically pulled from your AdRoll profile. Make sure the URL defined on your advertiser profile is accurate.

Placements guide

Your image and text display will change depending on where the ad is shown. Learn more about display specs on Facebook’s Ad Guide.

Mobile App Install

If your goal is to promote your app, our goal is to make sure your mobile visitors click to install your app on their smartphones and tablets.

Ad Image

Your image file must meet the following specification to be accepted:

File format: JPEG, GIF (static), PNG

File size: Maximum 1MB

Image dimensions: 1200×627. A large image displays best on tablets.

20% Text Limit: Facebook notes that images with minimal text are more engaging. Limit any text to 20% of the image surface. Want to double check? Inspect your image with Facebook's Grid Tool.
Ad Text

Once your image is accepted, you'll submit the text portions of your ad:

Title (required): 25 characters, including spaces

  • This is typically the name of your app.

Text (required): 110 characters, including spaces

  • Provide a short description of your app, similar to what appears in the app store.

Destination URL: App store URL (iTunes or Google Play)

Facebook App ID: Found in the Basic Settings section of your Facebook Developers account. You must register your app with Facebook to generate your unique Facebook App ID.
Ad Placement

Your ad will appear on Facebook mobile news feed.

What Do Mobile App Install Ads Look Like?

Your ad will display differently on different screen sizes. Learn more about mobile display specs on Facebook’s Ad Guide.
